DataElement.preferredDefinition: The classification system used to indicate the intensity of an unfavorable, unintended consequence associated with a medical treatment, intervention, or procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:A morphologic classification system of malignant tumors, usually relating to disease progression and clinical outcome.  It is based upon the presence or absence of several morphologic parameters, including tumor cell necrosis, cytologic atypia, nuclear pleomorphism and mitotic figures, the architectural infiltrating patterns, and the degree of tumor cell differentiation.  Malignant tumors usually are graded I-III.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

A morphologic classification system of malignant tumors, usually relating to disease progression and clinical outcome.  It is based upon the presence or absence of several morphologic parameters, including tumor cell necrosis, cytologic atypia, nuclear pleomorphism and mitotic figures, the architectural infiltrating patterns, and the degree of tumor cell differentiation.  Malignant tumors usually are graded I-III.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 7/25/23 Created per PCDC metadata template. mr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A morphologic classification system of malignant tumors, usually relating to disease progression and clinical outcome.  It is based upon the presence or absence of several morphologic parameters, including tumor cell necrosis, cytologic atypia, nuclear pleomorphism and mitotic figures, the architectural infiltrating patterns, and the degree of tumor cell differentiation.  Malignant tumors usually are graded I-III._A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Balis Pediatric Scale of Peripheral Neuropathies
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An instrument used to grade neurotoxicity occurring in children on a 0-4 scale, where the higher number indicates worse neuropathy.

Concepts.longName: Balis Pediatric Scale of Peripheral Neuropathies
Concepts.definition: An instrument used to grade neurotoxicity occurring in children on a 0-4 scale, where the higher number indicates worse neuropathy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Concepts.longName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
Concepts.definition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

PermissibleValues.value: European Society for Blood and Marrow Transplantation (EBMT)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: European Society for Blood and Marrow Transplantation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-profit organization established in 1974 to allow scientists and physicians involved in clinical bone marrow transplantations to share experiences and develop co-operative studies.

Concepts.longName: European Society for Blood and Marrow Transplantation
Concepts.definition: A non-profit organization established in 1974 to allow scientists and physicians involved in clinical bone marrow transplantations to share experiences and develop co-operative studies.
